metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9793 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The sock_setsockopt function in net/core/sock.c in the Linux kernel before4.8.14 mishandles negative values of sk_sndbuf and sk_rcvbuf, which allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and systemcrash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging theCAP_NET_ADMIN capability for a crafted setsockopt system call with the (1)SO_SNDBUFFORCE or (2) SO_RCVBUFFORCE option.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9793` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-59.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1040-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1040.47
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1044-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1044.48
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1003.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-59.80').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1040.47').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1044.48').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.12').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
